Key Match Events: Rashid Khan scored 48 not out from 23 balls.
Marcus Stoinis bowled the final over, securing the win for Australia.
Adam Zampa and Glenn Maxwell combined for three wickets in four balls.
Josh Hazlewood took the wicket of Mohammad Nabi.
Kane Richardson removed Rahmanullah Gurbaz for 30 off 17 balls.
Glenn Maxwell scored an unbeaten 54 from 32 balls.
Fazalhaq Farooqi bowled Matthew Wade with a brilliant yorker.
Naveen-ul-Haq dismissed David Warner and Steven Smith.
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan won the toss and chose to bowl first.
Aaron Finch and Tim David were ruled out with hamstring injuries.
Matthew Wade captained Australia in Finch's absence.
Mitchell Starc was left out of the Australian team.
Rashid Khan played despite concerns over his knee and back.
Post-Match Reflections: Australia's net run rate was not improved significantly by the win.
Australia needed Sri Lanka to beat England to advance to the semi-finals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia needed to restrict Afghanistan to 106 or below to improve their net run rate above England's.
Australia's heavy defeat to New Zealand impacted their chances of advancing.
